problem_overview.Problem_description: The task is to predict the final sales price of residential properties in Ames, Iowa using various features such as lot size, neighborhood, building type, overall quality/condition, basement/garage info, and more. This is a supervised regression problem where the target variable is continuous.

target_variable.name: SalePrice
target_variable.description: The final sales price of the property in USD, which is the target variable for prediction.

data_description.name: MSSubClass
data_description.description: Type of dwelling involved in the sale, categorized numerically.

data_description.name: Neighborhood
data_description.description: Physical location within Ames city limits.

data_description.name: OverallQual
data_description.description: Rates the overall material and finish of the house on a scale of 1 to 10.

data_description.name: GrLivArea
data_description.description: Above grade (ground) living area in square feet.

data_description.name: GarageCars
data_description.description: Size of garage in car capacity.

data_description.name: YearBuilt
data_description.description: Year the house was originally constructed.

model_feasibility.justification: The dataset has sufficient structure for modeling, with a defined target variable and a valid data profile. No critical blocking issues were detected.

primary_metric.name: Root-Mean-Squared-Error (RMSE) on log-transformed values
primary_metric.description: Measures the average squared difference between the logarithm of predicted and actual sale prices, ensuring errors on expensive and inexpensive homes are weighted equally.

secondary_metrics.name: Mean Absolute Error (MAE)
secondary_metrics.description: Measures the average absolute difference between predicted and actual sale prices, providing a simpler error metric.

secondary_metrics.name: R-squared
secondary_metrics.description: Indicates the proportion of variance in the target variable explained by the model.

validation_strategy.description: The dataset will be split into 5 folds for cross-validation to ensure robust evaluation of the model. Stratification is not required as the target variable is continuous.

prediction_strategy.workflow: Predictions will be generated in batches for the test set and exported as a CSV file.
prediction_strategy.usage_context: Results will be consumed by stakeholders for decision-making in real estate transactions and market analysis.

business_value_kpis.description: Tracks the RMSE of the model on the test set to ensure accurate property price predictions.
Provides stakeholders with actionable insights into property pricing trends.
Measures the satisfaction of real estate agents, buyers, and sellers with the model's predictions.
